page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY SAWLEY HALL
page.content: Sawley Hall was built in 1770,one of only two Georgian houses built on a hill because there was a supply of water.It was first built as a Dower house for Lord Grantley's wife.Four families have owned it-the Nortons,the Wormaulds,the Barrans,and since 1962, the Fattorinis. In 1935 there were 1800 acres,in 1985 there are 80.There are beautifully and exquisitely laid- out gardens.In 1935 there were 21 servants,now there are none, just a housekeeper and a gardener. There is a fire pond.There is a cock- pit,hidden deep in a wood and sur- rounded by two walls.There is a unique water pump driven by six horses.It also served to grind corn and to saw wood.They still have their own water supply pumped by electricity.Sawley Hall is not open to the public.
